con:testSuite.name: with networkOperatorId
con:testSuite.con:description:
GenerateVoucher request
numberOfVouchers i4 The maximum number of vouchers is 1000000.
activationCodeLength i4 Element Value Range: 8 - 20
currency XML-RPC datatype: <string> Element Size: 3 characters
serialNumber XML-RPC Data Type: <string> Element Size: 8 - 20 digits Allowed characters: 0 - 9
value XML-RPC datatype: <string> Element size: 1 - 12 digits Allowed characters: 0 - 9
voucherGroup XML-RPC datatype: <string> Element Size: 1 - 4 characters Allowed characters: A - Z, a - z, 0 - 9
expiryDate XML-RPC datatype: <dateTime.iso8601> Element Format: yyyyMMddThh:mm:ssTZ Element Value Range: See Table 78. Table 78 expiryDate Value Range Value Range Description yyyy 0001 - 9999 MM 01 - 12 dd 01 - 31 hh 00 mm 00 ss 00 TZ [+/-]0000
agent XML-RPC datatype: <string> Element Size: 1 - 8 characters Allowed characters: A - Z, a - z, 0 - 9
extensionText1-3 XML-RPC Data Type: <string> Element Size: 1 - 30 characters Allowed characters: -A-Za-z0-9_=:?.() Note: Space is an allowed character.
schedulation (execution time) XML-RPC datatype: <dateTime.iso8601> Element Format: yyyyMMddThh:mm:ssTZ Element Value Range: See Table 77.
networkOperatorId XML-RPC datatype: <string> Element Size: 0 - 20 characters Allowed characters: A-Z, a-z, 0-9

con:testCase.name: Generate Voucher
con:testCase.con:description:
Either activation code or serial number needs to be set but not both. If you set a network operator ID during the generation of the vouchers then you will need to provide them in your get voucher details call
Table 11 UpdateVocherState request allowed state changes oldState newState Entry Point unavailable available Standard unavailable damaged Standard unavailable stolen Standard available unavailable Standard available damaged Standard available stolen Standard pending available PC pending used PC stolen unavailable Standard stolen available Standard

con:request.name: generateVoucher - success
con:request.con:request:
<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:vss="http://vssim.services.hxc/"> <soapenv:Header/> <soapenv:Body> <vss:generateVoucher> <request> <activationCodeLength>9</activationCodeLength> <!--Optional:-->
<!--Optional:--> <currency>${#TestSuite#currency}</currency> <!--Optional:--> <expiryDate>${date+3 days#result}</expiryDate> <!--Optional:--> <agent>agent1</agent> <!--Optional:--> <extensionText1>ext1</extensionText1> <!--Optional:--> <extensionText2>ext2</extensionText2> <!--Optional:-->
<numberOfVouchers>10</numberOfVouchers> <!--Optional:--> <extensionText3>ext3</extensionText3><schedulation> <!--Optional:--> <executionTime>${time + 20 sec first#result}</executionTime> </schedulation><networkOperatorId>OperatorId</networkOperatorId> <!--Optional:--> <serialNumber>111111110</serialNumber> <value>1000000</value> <!--Optional:--> <voucherGroup>GRP1</voucherGroup> </request> </vss:generateVoucher> </soapenv:Body> </soapenv:Envelope>

con:testSuite.name: without networkOperatorId
con:testSuite.con:description:
GenerateVoucher request
numberOfVouchers i4 The maximum number of vouchers is 1000000.
activationCodeLength i4 Element Value Range: 8 - 20
currency XML-RPC datatype: <string> Element Size: 3 characters
serialNumber XML-RPC Data Type: <string> Element Size: 8 - 20 digits Allowed characters: 0 - 9
value XML-RPC datatype: <string> Element size: 1 - 12 digits Allowed characters: 0 - 9
voucherGroup XML-RPC datatype: <string> Element Size: 1 - 4 characters Allowed characters: A - Z, a - z, 0 - 9
expiryDate XML-RPC datatype: <dateTime.iso8601> Element Format: yyyyMMddThh:mm:ssTZ Element Value Range: See Table 78. Table 78 expiryDate Value Range Value Range Description yyyy 0001 - 9999 MM 01 - 12 dd 01 - 31 hh 00 mm 00 ss 00 TZ [+/-]0000
agent XML-RPC datatype: <string> Element Size: 1 - 8 characters Allowed characters: A - Z, a - z, 0 - 9
extensionText1-3 XML-RPC Data Type: <string> Element Size: 1 - 30 characters Allowed characters: -A-Za-z0-9_=:?.() Note: Space is an allowed character.
schedulation (execution time) XML-RPC datatype: <dateTime.iso8601> Element Format: yyyyMMddThh:mm:ssTZ Element Value Range: See Table 77.
networkOperatorId XML-RPC datatype: <string> Element Size: 0 - 20 characters Allowed characters: A-Z, a-z, 0-9

con:testCase.name: Generate Voucher
con:testCase.con:description:
Either activation code or serial number needs to be set but not both. If you set a network operator ID during the generation of the vouchers then you will need to provide them in your get voucher details call
Table 11 UpdateVocherState request allowed state changes oldState newState Entry Point unavailable available Standard unavailable damaged Standard unavailable stolen Standard available unavailable Standard available damaged Standard available stolen Standard pending available PC pending used PC stolen unavailable Standard stolen available Standard
